title: 6.17 ping issues
body: My ping has doubled since the patch, from about 40 to 80. I have seen a few posts with people experiencing similar issues since the patch and haven't been able to find any answers. Anyone know if there has been an update or anything about this?

replies.body: I am also having a similar problem, my ping initially was around 50-70 but it has jumped to over 280... This might also be a problem with suddenlink. I saw a few posts a while back about suddenlink having bad connections with the servers? Is there anyway that someone can fix that? I am in Flagstaff Arizona by the way.

Since patches only update files in your local League directory, they're *very unlikely* to affect your connection. I've seen a few other posts about latency increases, and I'm curious what ISP you're using.

We can take a look at your route to the server and see if there are issues before your connection hits the League servers. We can do this if you run a traceroute log using [WinMTR.](http://winmtr.net/) After opening the application, plug in the IP address 104.160.131.1 and run the trace for 5 minutes before exporting your results as a text. You can paste the results here so I can take a look.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Your route looks particularly troubling. Your connection to your own network is great, but on the first hop outside your network, your latency hits 82ms of latency, then spikes up to 3135ms  on the Level 3 node at 5-2-20.bear2.Phoenix1.Level3.net

Since the issues are along Suddenlink and Level3's networks, you'll want to reach out and work with Suddenlink's Tier 2 support to start an investigation. Providing them this screenshot will give them additional context on the issue and provide them with specific nodes to look at.

Let me know if you have any questions or concerns with this.

Dewey, AZ here. Cableone. Ping is normally around 70 but jumped up to around 100 today.

http://imgur.com/a/AVURX

It appears that once your connection hits the third 4th hop into the Zayo network, your connection reaches 143ms of latency and pretty much stays in the low to mid 100's of latency along the rest of your journey to the server. To have this looked into and resolved, you'll want to reach out to your ISP's tier 2 support and provide them this screenshot so they have some routing context to work with. 

Let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks for getting back to me with this traceroute. It looks like your route is fine up until you hit the Level 3 node at 4.35.80.238, where your connection jumps to 98ms of latency. 

Since Level 3 is a backbone network provider that partners with your ISP to deliver your connection to specific servers, you'll want to reach out to your ISP's tier 2 support about it. I strongly recommend providing them this traceroute, since it will give them context on where the issue lies.

Let me know if you have any questions about this.

Yeah I've been getting weird ping too, it usually stays at like a steady 35-40 but it's recently started to jump to 200-300ping. This definitely never happened until the patch hit. Hoping there's a fix soon.
